master.commit_message:
Merge pull request #119 from poncovka/master-externally_managed_debian

CI: Don't use the externally managed environment on Debian

CI: Don't use the externally managed environment on Debian

Use the fix from the commit ec1ae5b1bbb1fb46e8d461c266311219b010a98e.

Merge pull request #117 from poncovka/master-fix_failing_tests

CI: Fix the failing tests

CI: Don't use the externally managed environment on Ubuntu

Based on https://peps.python.org/pep-0668/, operating systems can now mark their
Python environments as "externally managed. Because of that, Ubuntu tests are now
failing with the "This environment is externally managed" error. Create a virtual
environment and use it instead to fix the tests.

CI: Fix locale settings in testing containers

Documentation builds started to fail with the `unsupported locale setting` error
since Sphinx removed its workaround for `locale.setlocale(locale.LC_ALL, '')`.

Based on https://peps.python.org/pep-0538/, Linux containers should set only
`LC_CTYPE=C.UTF-8` to get a consistent behaviour across all distributions.

CI: Fix the Pylint warnings about the overgeneral-exceptions option

Specifying exception names in the overgeneral-exceptions option without module
name is deprecated and support for it will be removed in pylint 3.0. Use fully
qualified name (maybe 'builtins.Exception' ?) instead.

Merge pull request #111 from poncovka/master-src

Move the source files to /src

CI: Run tests on the installed package in Travis

* Run `make install` to build and install the `dasbus` package.
* Run `make test-install` to test the installed `dasbus` package.

CI: Use pytest instead of unittest

* Run the unit tests with pytest instead of unittest.
* Keep the pytest configuration in the pyproject.toml file.

CI: Remove the .coveragerc file

Move the configuration to the pyproject.toml file.

CI: Add the pyproject.toml file

* Keep info about the Python package in the pyproject.toml file.
* Run `python -m build` to build the distribution archive.
* Fix building on Debian and Ubuntu by installing python3-venv.
* Follow the latest Python packaging guidelines in the .spec file.
* Remove setup.py.

Move the source files to /src

Move the source files of the dasbus package to the /src directory, so
we can easily run tests on the source files and on the installed files.

CI: Update the .packit.yaml file

* Resolve warnings from `packit validate-config`.
* Use `upstream_tag_template` to get the current version.
* Enable Packit tests on pull requests.
* Run pull request jobs only for Fedora Rawhide.
* Disable Copr builds for Anaconda-devel.
